author: Special Correspondent
text:
Two persons have been arrested in connection with the loot of the Venmani Primary Agricultural Cooperative Society in Nagapattinam district. One of them is the appraiser with the PACS while the other is his relative.

The murder of Kamaraj (56), secretary of the Venmani PACS and the loot of gold jewellery worth Rs. 3 cr. from the society a couple of days back rattled the officials and police alike.

Investigations were intensified and suspicion pointed to the involvement of appraiser Ganapathy in the crime.

Intense interrogation of Ganapathy showed that he along with his relative and pawn broker Panjatcharam (38) of Easwari Nagar in Thanjavur had spike a soft drink and offered it to Kamaraj.

When the official dozed off, they took the locker room key, opened the room and took away the jewels weighing around 11 kg besides Rs. 2.5 lakh in cash.

While Ganapathy was tied to a chair and he feigned that he had been assaulted too, Panjatcharam fled with the booty.

When Ganapathy spilled the beans, police searched Panjatcharam’s house in Thanjavur and recovered a gunny bag containing the valuables from the septic tank of his house.

It is said that around Rs. 27 lakh and 821 gram of gold jewellery were missing.

The two were produced before the court in Nagapattinam and remanded in judicial custody.
title: Two held for PACS secretary murder
